metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7156 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The x86_emulate function in arch/x86/x86_emulate/x86_emulate.c in Xen 3.3.x through 4.4.x does not check the supervisor mode permissions for instructions that generate software interrupts, which allows local HVM guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xen-utils-common - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
xenstore-utils - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-0ubuntu5.2').
